Package io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.services.impl

Class AbstractScheduler<T>

java.lang.Object
io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.services.impl.AbstractScheduler<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of elements that are stored in a map to maintain relation between key and job.
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPlatformScheduler
Direct Known Subclasses:
NativeThreadPoolScheduler
@Singleton public abstract class AbstractScheduler<T> extends Object implements IPlatformScheduler
Implements an abstract base class for schedulers with some useful utilities.

The provided utilities are optional. No implementors of schedulers need to derive from this class. Nevertheless it is beneficial.

A map is managed to create a relation between artificial job keys and job informations.

  • Field Details

    • MINIMAL_PERIOD_MILLISECONDS

      public static final long MINIMAL_PERIOD_MILLISECONDS
      The minimal milliseconds a schedule must use for its re-occurring period.

      Schedules lower than this value will be ignored. Lower values impose a risk of workload overloading. 

       MINIMAL_PERIOD_MILLISECONDS = 10L
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractScheduler

      public AbstractScheduler()

  • Method Details

    • putJob

      public String putJob(T jobInfo)
      Stores the job information and assigns a unique ID/key for the data.

      A unique is created with createUniqueRandomKey() and used to store the job information in a map, maintaining a relation between the job information data and the key.

      Parameters:
      jobInfo - the information of the job to store.
      Returns:
      A unique key for the job.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - in case no unique key can be created after MAX_RETRIES_FOR_UNIQUENESS tries.

    • getJob

      public T getJob(String jobKey)
      Retrieves previously stored job information.
      Parameters:
      jobKey - the key of the job information data as created previously with putJob(Object)
      Returns:
      The information of the job as stored previously with putJob(Object) or null if none has been stored for that key.

    • getKey

      public String getKey(T jobInfo)
      Retrieves previously stored job information.

      The bare memory reference of the job information is compared unless the type implements interface Comparable.

      Parameters:
      jobInfo - the information of the job that has been stored previously.
      Returns:
      The unique key for the previously stored job or null in case the job has not been stored yet.

    • removeJob

      public T removeJob(String jobKey)
      Remove a previously stored job information.
      Parameters:
      jobKey - the key of the job information data as created previously with putJob(Object)
      Returns:
      The information of the job as stored previously with putJob(Object) or null if none has been stored for that key.

    • hasJob

      public boolean hasJob()
      Checks whether there is a scheduled job.
      Returns:
      true if at least one job is scheduled, false otherwise.

    • getAllJobKey

      public String[] getAllJobKey()
      Get an array of all active job keys.
      Returns:
      An array of all keys of active jobs or String[0] if no job information is available. No null is returned.

    • createUniqueRandomKey

      protected String createUniqueRandomKey()
      Create a unique random key to be used for a job.

      Various tries are performed to get hold on a unique key. Random keys are created and checked with the map of internally stored jobs. In case the key is not used, it is unique and returned.
      If a unique key can not be determined after MAX_RETRIES_FOR_UNIQUENESS, then an exception is thrown.

      Returns:
      A unique key for the job.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - in case no unique key can be created after MAX_RETRIES_FOR_UNIQUENESS tries.

    • createRandomKey

      protected String createRandomKey()
      Create a random key.
      Returns:
      A random key derived from bytes of length KEY_BYTE_LEN.
